metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014 at the aruyangpo station, upstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located in yangpo, north of ahrou township, qilian county, qinghai province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.5204E, 38.0898N and 3529m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 5m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;Two photosynthetically active radiators were installed at 6m, facing due south, and one probe was vertically upward and downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm underground, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe is buried at 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:(unit: Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit:Volumetric water content, percentage), upward and downward photosynthetically active radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (in micromol/m2 seconds).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Due to problems with the solar controller, data was missing between July 28 and August 14, 2014;(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: September 10, 2014, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al.(2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游阿柔阳坡站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县阿柔乡北侧阳坡，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.5204E, 38.0898N，海拔3529m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在并距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于太阳能控制器出现问题，在2014.7.28-8.14之间数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热成像相机获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。接着，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，该实验针对异质土地表面，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些都需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，早在1990年代初就启动，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱黑河流域生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，进而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作），以及2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS，以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在阿柔冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。

Example.AnswerEn: In this field, soil and canopy component temperatures can be collected using a high-resolution thermal infrared camera. The thermal camera is manually operated on a platform to measure thermal radiation of cropland, which is then used to calculate the component temperatures by classifying images into soil and canopy pixels. Example.AnswerEn: Snow cover data in alpine regions can be collected using a snow observation superstation equipped with instruments like the SR50A sensor for snow depth and the GMON for snow water equivalent (SWE). Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with data collection in the alpine region for hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区进行水文研究时，数据收集面临的挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: Data collection in the alpine region faces several challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography. These factors inhibit complete and consistent data collection, hinder the development of remote sensing technologies, and compromise the efficacy of alpine hydrological models. Additionally, the scarcity of observation data due to difficulties in access and technological barriers has historically limited research in this field.
Definition.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集面临着几个挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形。这些因素抑制了完整和一致的数据收集，阻碍了遥感技术的发展，并影响了阿尔卑斯水文模型的有效性。此外，由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺历史上限制了该领域的研究。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'gap-free meteorological and hydrological data' mean in the context of observational datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在观测数据集的背景下，“无间隙的气象和水文数据”指的是没有缺失或中断的连续数据记录。
Definition.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data refer to continuous and uninterrupted datasets collected from observation networks, which ensure consistent coverage over the desired period. These datasets are critical for accurately monitoring and analyzing environmental processes, such as snow accumulation, ablation, and freeze-thaw cycles, without the interruptions that can result from sensor malfunctions or power loss.
Definition.AnswerCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据是指从观测网络收集的连续且不间断的数据集，确保在所需时间段内的一致覆盖。这些数据集对于准确监测和分析环境过程（如雪积累、融化和冻结-融化循环）至关重要，因为它们避免了传感器故障或电源丧失可能导致的中断。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for hydrometeorological observations in alpine regions differ from those used in agricultural areas with strong advection?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在高山地区的水文气象观测中，数据收集方法与在强平流的农业区域使用的方法有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data collection in alpine regions often involves overcoming challenges such as harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topographies, using automatic meteorological stations and snow superstations to capture data like snow cover and frozen ground characteristics. In contrast, data collection in agricultural areas with strong advection may focus more on measuring soil and canopy component temperatures and latent heat fluxes, using tools like high-resolution thermal cameras and eddy covariance systems to address issues such as strong advective conditions and energy balance closure.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，水文气象数据收集常常面临严酷气候、高海拔和复杂地形等挑战，使用自动气象站和雪超级站来捕捉雪盖和冻土特征等数据。相比之下，在强平流的农业地区，数据收集更侧重于测量土壤和冠层组分温度以及潜热通量，使用高分辨率热像仪和涡度协方差系统等工具，以应对强平流条件和能量平衡闭合等问题。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using soil and canopy component temperatures in estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中使用土壤和冠层组分温度来估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散的影响是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Using soil and canopy component temperatures can improve the estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes by allowing accurate separation of soil and vegetation energy exchanges. This method addresses limitations of one-source models in such landscapes and enhances model reliability, even in challenging conditions like strongly advective environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用土壤和冠层组件温度可以改善对异质景观中蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散的估算，通过准确分离土壤和植被的能量交换。这种方法解决了在此类景观中单源模型的局限性，并提高了模型的可靠性，即使在强烈的平流环境等挑战性条件下也是如此。

Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to accurately estimate soil heat conductivity in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，准确估计土壤热导率的难度是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the causes of data scarcity in alpine hydrological research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯水文研究中数据稀缺的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in the alpine region is due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, which has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research. This scarcity has motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难和技术障碍，这阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模及相关研究。这种稀缺性促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential impacts on data accuracy when using an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in alpine hydrology research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中，使用集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络对数据准确性可能产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network can improve data accuracy by providing comprehensive datasets that capture diverse hydrological and meteorological processes. This approach allows for accurate forcing data for hydrological models and validation of remote sensing products, ultimately enhancing the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络可以通过提供全面的数据集来提高数据的准确性，这些数据集捕捉了多样的水文和气象过程。这种方法可以为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，并验证遥感产品，最终增强对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives behind establishing an integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the upper reaches of river basins?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在河流上游地区建立综合性高山水文观测网络的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives are to provide accurate forcing data for alpine hydrological models, integrate observations with simulations for a better understanding, and examine how perturbations like climate change and human activities alter fundamental processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是为高山水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，将观测与模拟相结合以更好地理解，并研究气候变化和人类活动等扰动如何改变基本过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What integrated observational approaches are used to measure snow cover and frozen ground properties in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，测量雪盖和冻土特性的综合观测方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: An integrated observation network includes automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground. Observations of snow cover properties include snow depth and snow water equivalent measured by ultrasonic sensors and GammaMONitors, respectively. Blowing snow is measured using FlowCapt devices. For frozen ground, soil temperature and moisture profiles are measured at multiple depths to capture freeze-thaw processes, and additional measurements include soil thermal and hydraulic conductivities.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 一个综合观测网络包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土的超级站。雪盖特性的观测包括通过超声波传感器测量的雪深和通过GammaMONitors测量的雪水当量。吹雪通过FlowCapt设备进行测量。对于冻土，土壤温度和湿度在多个深度进行测量，以捕捉冻融过程，其他测量还包括土壤的热导率和水力导率。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the technological advancements that have enabled the collection of detailed hydrometeorological data in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高山地区收集详细的水文气象数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations equipped with advanced instruments such as four-component radiometers, thermal infrared cameras, and eddy covariance systems has enabled the collection of detailed hydrometeorological data. These technologies allow for high-resolution monitoring of variables like air temperature, wind speed, humidity, soil heat flux, and snow cover properties even in challenging alpine environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站（AMSs）和配备先进仪器的超级气象站，如四分量辐射计、热红外相机和涡度协方差系统，使得详细的水文气象数据收集成为可能。这些技术能够在困难的高山环境中高分辨率地监测空气温度、风速、湿度、土壤热通量和雪盖特性等变量。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do integrated observation networks contribute to the monitoring and modeling of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 综合观测网络如何促进对高山地区水文过程的监测和建模？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Integrated observation networks, which consist of distributed meteorological stations and superstations for specific observations like snow and frozen ground, provide comprehensive datasets that facilitate the monitoring and modeling of hydrological processes. These networks enable the capture of spatially distributed data, necessary for validating remote sensing products and improving the accuracy of alpine hydrological models.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 综合观测网络由分布式气象站和用于特定观测（如雪和冻土）的超级站组成，提供全面的数据集，便于监测和建模水文过程。这些网络能够捕获空间分布的数据，必要于验证遥感产品并提高高山水文模型的准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and challenges must be overcome to collect accurate snow cover and frozen ground data in alpine environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高山环境中收集准确的雪盖和冻土数据必须克服哪些条件和挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges such as harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topography must be overcome to collect accurate data. Technological barriers like sensor malfunctions and power loss in high altitudes also pose difficulties. Addressing these challenges requires the development of robust observation methods and instruments, such as the use of FlowCapt for drifting snow measurement and GMON for snow water equivalent assessment, to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 收集准确数据必须克服诸如恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形等挑战。技术障碍，如传感器故障和高海拔地区的电力损失，也带来了困难。解决这些挑战需要开发稳健的观测方法和仪器，例如使用FlowCapt进行漂流雪测量和GMON进行雪水当量评估，以确保数据的准确性和完整性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions be a significant challenge for data collection and modeling?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺性可能会对数据收集和建模构成重大挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions is primarily due to difficulties of access and technological barriers, which hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. The cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography further inhibit complete and consistent data collection, affecting the availability of high-quality data for parameterization and model validation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，这阻碍了遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展。寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形进一步妨碍了完整和一致的数据收集，影响了高质量数据的可用性，从而影响了参数化和模型验证。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is accurate forcing data crucial for alpine hydrological models, and what challenges might arise in obtaining such data?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 准确的强迫数据对阿尔卑斯水文模型至关重要，因为它直接影响模型的预测能力和水文过程的理解。获取这些数据可能面临的挑战包括：数据的空间和时间分辨率不足、气候变化带来的不确定性、测量设备的局限性、以及地形复杂性导致的局部气候变化等。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurate forcing data is crucial for alpine hydrological models because it provides the necessary input to simulate hydrological processes accurately. However, challenges arise in obtaining such data due to the limited number of weather stations and the lack of comprehensive snow and frozen ground data, which are critical for parameterizing and validating these models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 准确的强迫数据对于高山水文模型至关重要，因为它提供了必要的输入，以准确模拟水文过程。然而，由于气象站数量有限以及缺乏全面的雪和冻土数据，这些数据对于参数化和验证这些模型至关重要，因此在获取这些数据时会面临挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might integrating ground-based and remote sensing data be beneficial for improving hydrological process predictions in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 将地面观测数据与遥感数据结合起来，可能对改善高山地区水文过程预测有益的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based and remote sensing data can improve hydrological process predictions in alpine regions by providing a more comprehensive understanding of these processes. Remote sensing data, combined with data assimilation techniques, can enhance the prediction capabilities despite the complexities and uncertainties present in the earth system, especially in alpine regions where observational data is scarce.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 整合地面观测数据和遥感数据可以提高高山地区水文过程预测的准确性，因为这提供了对这些过程更全面的理解。遥感数据结合数据同化技术，可以增强预测能力，尽管在地球系统中存在复杂性和不确定性，尤其是在观测数据稀缺的高山地区。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, to what extent do current observational networks and experiments meet the needs for accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在我看来，目前的观测网络和实验在多大程度上满足了阿尔卑斯水文模型对准确有效的强迫数据的需求？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current observational networks and experiments are essential for providing accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, despite challenges in data scarcity. These networks, such as the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the Heihe River Basin, aim to fill knowledge gaps and support model development, though continuous effort is required to maintain data quality and coverage.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的观测网络和实验对于提供准确有效的强迫数据以支持高山水文模型至关重要，尽管面临数据稀缺的挑战。这些网络，例如黑河流域的综合高山水文观测网络，旨在填补知识空白并支持模型开发，尽管需要持续努力以维护数据质量和覆盖范围。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection techniques can ensure reliable measurements in high-altitude and harsh climate conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集技术如何能确保在高海拔和恶劣气候条件下的可靠测量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting automatic meteorological stations. To capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected using state-of-the-art instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were obtained to capture freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接自动气象站的观测网络进行监测。为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进仪器收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集则通过一个冻土观测超级站获取，以捕捉冻融过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how integrated observation networks contribute to understanding hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解综合观测网络如何有助于理解高山地区的水文过程。
Assertion.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological-snow-frozen ground observation network has been established, consisting of automatic meteorological stations and superstations. This network collects data for investigating meteorological driving forces and validates alpine hydrological models, providing high-quality data for snow and frozen ground observations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络已经建立，包含自动气象站和超级站。该网络收集数据以研究气象驱动因素，并验证高山水文模型，为雪和冻土观测提供高质量的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in collecting hydrometeorological data in alpine regions and propose potential solutions to address these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在高山地区收集水文气象数据所面临的挑战，并提出解决这些挑战的潜在方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting hydrometeorological data in alpine regions include cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit complete and consistent data collection. Scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers has also hindered research. Potential solutions may involve developing next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments, enhancing remote sensing technologies, and integrating distributed and multiscale observation datasets that can provide accurate forcing data for modeling and validation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集水文气象数据的挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺也妨碍了研究。潜在的解决方案可能包括开发下一代生态观测网络和实验、增强遥感技术，以及整合分布式和多尺度观测数据集，以提供准确的强迫数据用于建模和验证。
